page.title: 12Tourist facilities, St.John
page.content:
Jersey is an important centre for Tourism and the Parishes of St. John and Trinity cater for visitors to the Island in several ways.
There are two{hotels}situated in Bonne Nuit Bay and several private guest houses of varying sizes. Four{public houses}cater for those in need of refreshment. An{arts and craft centre}known as "Jersey Pearl," produces locally assembled jewellery and allows the public access to its workshops. Here there is also a{restaurant. Other places of interest to the visitor are{St. John's Church,}the {Shopping Precinct, Bonne Nuit Bay}and {La Crete Fort}which is a small fortification constructed in the 18th Century to provide defence against smugglers and invaders.
